data.title: Education Programs Manager
data.meta_description: California IT in Education (CITE) is now hiring for the position of Education Programs Manager in Sacramento. Apply today.
data.text:
About the Org: California IT in Education (CITE) is a nonprofit professional association serving K-12 technologists in California schools, districts, charters, and county offices of education. More information can be found at www.cite.org.

About the Position: CITE is committed to serving its members with high-quality professional development programs. The Education Programs Manager will develop, facilitate, and administer education programs for California K-12 technology professionals. This position will support the CTO Mentor Program as well as the expansion of education programs delivered to the K-12 technology community. The Education Programs Manager will report to the Director of Education Programs. To learn more about working at CITE, visit our employment page.

About the Hiring Process: CITE will accept applications throughout August. First-round interviews will be held in early September, followed by a take-home assignment and final panel interview. We hope to make an offer by the end of September.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES

Manage CTO Mentor Program

Administer yearly application process and select students

Train mentors and instructors and provide feedback on class content

Coach students throughout the program to ensure quality learning experience

Administer program budgets and expenses

Deliver selected lessons or course sessions as needed

Attend in-person and virtual sessions (Note: classes occur on evenings and weekends)

Evaluate program using qualitative and quantitative methods

Support existing education programs and design new education programs

Review or create curriculum, update materials, and refine processes

Research and update course content

Collaborate with peers to design and scale program processes

Develop strategies to attract new districts and diverse students to our programs

Coordinate work and evaluate products of independent consultants

Define requirements and workplans for outside consultants

Recruit and manage facilitators and subject matter experts

Complete ongoing Education Team tasks

Create regular program reports for leadership, Board, and other audiences

Write selected articles, program descriptions, and other content to recruit program participants

Collaborate with Director of Education Programs on projects to support strategic priorities

Build trusting relationships with program alumni and recruit them for volunteer opportunities

Support production of Annual Conference by scheduling select sessions, delivering CITE Education Program presentations, and completing event production tasks as part of all-staff team (e.g., registration desk, organizing supplies, etc.)

Other duties as assigned

REQUIREMENTS

Minimum of bachelor’s degree in program administration, education, or related field (preferred: master’s degree)

At least five years’ experience delivering professional content to adults in both in-person and online settings

At least three years’ experience designing course content and activities

Principles, practices, and techniques of training and instruction delivered to adults

Excellent oral presentation skills

Experience and comfort with group facilitation

Experience in building digital courses and administering online learning management systems (Instructure/Canvas preferred)

Principles, practices, and techniques for project and program administration including goal setting, budget management, and evaluation

Experience in preparing clear, logical, and concise written communications which may include reports, memos, articles, and presentations

Preferred: Experience in California K-12 education settings

Preferred: Experience in education technology professional development

ABILITY TO

Exercise independent judgement and initiative within organization guidelines

Communicate with tact and diplomacy when dealing with complex and confidential student and member situations

Establish and maintain highly effective working relationships with colleagues within and outside of the organization

Demonstrate strong computer skills and high proficiency in Microsoft Office, Zoom, and Google Workspace

WORKING CONDITIONS AND PHYSICAL DEMANDS

Ability to lift 20+ pound boxes to a height of three feet and move onto carts or vehicles

Must be able to remain in stationary position for extended periods

Constantly operates computer and other office equipment

Must be able to work irregular hours, including evenings and weekends

Valid California driver’s license

Ability to travel independently in California to attend live sessions approximately two to four days per month; sessions may be on evenings and weekends

Ability to travel independently to partner conferences and districts as needed

Ability to travel independently and participate in CITE Annual Conference (full week, before or after Thanksgiving week depending on year, California locations)

This is a remote position based in California with required in-state travel. Our organization is unable to offer employment to non-California residents. If applying from out of state, please provide a cover letter explaining the status of your relocation to California in order to be considered for the position. As a small nonprofit, we are unable to offer relocation assistance.

This is an exempt position. This description reflects management’s assignment of essential functions, it does not proscribe or restrict the tasks that may be assigned.

CITE is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against candidates and employees because of their disability, sex, race, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, age, veteran status, or any other protected status under the law.

CITE promotes an inclusive workplace; reasonable accommodation requests for interviews can be made.
